su_556463: ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -crf 30 -b:v 0 output.webm

ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -b:v 5M -pass 1 -f webm /dev/null && \
ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -b:v 5M -pass 2 output.webm

ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -minrate 5M -maxrate 5M -b:v 5M output.webm

ffmpeg -i [VIDEO NAME].[FORMAT] -vcodec -s mpeg4 -vpre [VIDEO PRESET EX. MEDIUM/HIGH ] -b [BANDWIDTH] -s [WIDTH]*[HEIGHT] -acodec copy [OUTPUT VIDEO NAME].avi

ffmpeg -i Myvideo.mp4 -vcodec -s mpeg4 -vpre medium -b 3000k -s 700x292 -acodec copy Output.avi

Explanations about Options.-vcodec: Set the video codec. This is an alias for "-codec:v".
Explanations about Options.-n:
Do not overwrite output files, and exit immediately if a specified output file already
 exists.
Explanations about Options.-acodec: Set the audio codec. This is an alias for "-codec:a".
Explanations about Options.-t:
When used as an input option (before "-i"), limit the duration of data read from the
 input file.

ul_176886: ffmpeg -i file.m4a -f wav -acodec pcm_s16le -ac 2 - | \
    lame -m s -b 320 -q 0 --replaygain-accurate - file.mp3

so_7465223: lame -b 192 -h input.wav output.mp3  # bitrate 192, highest quality

apt-get install lame

man lame

Explanations about Options.--replaygain-accurate: Compute ReplayGain more accurately and find the peak sample.
Explanations about Options.-m: mode = s, j, f, d, m, l, r

au_904234: mencoder -vf stereo3d,scale sbs.mp4 -o anaglyph.mp4 -oac pcm -ovc x264

Explanations about Options.-fps: Override video framerate. Useful if the original value is wrong or missing.
Explanations about Options.-audiofile: Play audio from an external file (WAV, MP3 or Ogg Vorbis) while viewing a movie.
Explanations about Options.-vf: Prints the parameter names and parameter value ranges for a particular filter.
Explanations about Options.-oac:
Encode with the given audio codec (no default set).
 NOTE: Use -oac help to get a list of available audio codecs.
Explanations about Options.-v: Increment verbosity level, one level for each -v found on the command line.
Explanations about Options.-ofps:
Specify a frames per second (fps) value for the output file, which can be different
 from that of the source material. Must be set for variable fps (ASF, some MOV) and
 progressive (30000/1001 fps telecined MPEG) files.
Explanations about Options.-o:
Outputs to the given filename.
 If you want a default output filename, you can put this option in the MEncoder
 config file.
Explanations about Options.-ovc:
Encode with the given video codec (no default set).
 NOTE: Use -ovc help to get a list of available video codecs.
